titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Small Chemical Businesses records 1979-1993
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Small Chemical Businesses records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Small Chemical Businesses is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. Founded in 1978, it seeks to aid in the formation, development and growth of small chemical businesses by helping self-employed chemists and chemists working in small enterprises with the legal, social, educational, legislative, regulatory, and economic aspects of their work.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the ACS Division of Small Chemical Businesses. Materials include: Executive Committee agendas and minutes (1981-1989); history and by-laws of the division; financial records; copies of the Small Chem Biz Newsletter (1979-1993); programs and audiocassettes of symposia (1980-1990); and membership directories.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
